ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
numpy:
- '2'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
A ray-tracing framework for optical/non-optical physics simulations.

The aims of the Raysect project are as follows:

- develop a ray-tracer that is easy for scientists and engineers to use and extend
- the raytracer must be robust and high precision

The general development philosophy is ease of use trumps performance, but performance is not to be ignored.
about.summary: A Ray-tracing Framework for Science and Engineering

name: raysect

about.description:
A ray-tracing framework for optical/non-optical physics simulations.

The aims of the Raysect project are as follows:

- develop a ray-tracer that is easy for scientists and engineers to use and extend
- the raytracer must be robust and high precision

The general development philosophy is ease of use trumps performance, but performance is not to be ignored.
about.summary: A Ray-tracing Framework for Science and Engineering

about.description:
A ray-tracing framework for optical/non-optical physics simulations.

The aims of the Raysect project are as follows:

- develop a ray-tracer that is easy for scientists and engineers to use and extend

raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  name: raysect
  version: "0.9.1"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/${{ name|lower }}/source/archive/refs/tags/v${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 526c964ebdd551ea10b3ce9934bf0ed5856b34019200ede97b580f72a98a2168
  patches:
    - cross_compile.patch

build:
  number: 2
  skip:
    - win

requirements:
  build:
    - ${{ compiler("c") }}
    - ${{ stdlib("c") }}
    - ninja
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - python
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
        - pkg-config
        - cython >=3.1
        - numpy
  host:
    - python
    - python-build
    - pkg-config
    - pip
    - meson-python
    - setuptools
    - setuptools-scm
    - cython >=3.1
    - numpy
  run:
    - python
    - matplotlib-base
    - opencv
  run_exports:
    - ${{ pin_subpackage("raysect", upper_bound="x.x") }}

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - raysect
        - raysect.core
        - raysect.optical
        - raysect.optical.library
        - raysect.optical.observer
        - raysect.primitive
        - raysect.primitive.lens

  - script:
      - python -m unittest discover raysect -v

about:
  homepage: http://www.raysect.org
  summary: A Ray-tracing Framework for Science and Engineering
  description: |
    A ray-tracing framework for optical/non-optical physics simulations.

    The aims of the Raysect project are as follows:

    - develop a ray-tracer that is easy for scientists and engineers to use and extend
    - the raytracer must be robust and high precision

    The general development philosophy is ease of use trumps performance, but performance is not to be ignored.
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  documentation: http://www.raysect.org
  repository: https://github.com/raysect/source.git

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - munechika-koyo
